meanings.definition: To accustom (an infant or young mammal) to food other than its mother's milk.
meanings.sent1: The mother decided to weanel her baby onto solid foods.
meanings.sent2: It is important to weanel puppies onto dry food gradually.
meanings.sent3: The kitten tried to weanel itself onto the dog's food, thinking it was better.
meanings.sent4: She weaneled her child off sugary snacks, much to their dismay.
meanings.sent5: The zookeeper had to weanel the baby elephant off its mother's milk to ensure its health.

meanings.definition: To detach from a source of dependence.
meanings.sent1: He needed to weanel himself off his phone addiction.
meanings.sent2: It can be challenging to weanel a plant from constant sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The robot decided to weanel itself from its charging station and explore the room.
meanings.sent4: She had to weanel herself off her reliance on caffeine to feel more energized naturally.
meanings.sent5: The child had to weanel the teddy bear from being carried everywhere to become more independent.
